title: Amplification for Mixed Hearing Loss
chief_complaint: I am here for a second opinion regarding the sudden hearing loss in my right ear. Sounds are extremely painful in that ear, and I am having significant difficulty communicating.

problem_summary.onset: Longstanding bilateral otosclerosis; sudden hearing loss in the right ear occurred a few weeks after a healed tympanic membrane perforation.
problem_summary.course: Right stapedotomy 10 years ago provided initial improvement. Recent sudden drop in right hearing was treated with oral steroids and one intratympanic injection without improvement.
problem_summary.associated_symptoms: Right ear aural fullness, tinnitus, and extreme sensitivity to sound (hyperacusis).
problem_summary.functional_impact: Significant difficulty communicating due to combined mixed loss in left ear and new sudden loss/sensitivity in right ear.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Seeking second opinion and treatment options; currently using a loaner Pocketalker.

history.present_illness: Patient reports no improvement after first dexamethasone injection. Wears an earplug in the right ear due to loudness discomfort.
history.otologic_history: Bilateral otosclerosis. Right stapedotomy ~10 years ago. Recent right otitis media and perforation (healed).
history.prior_management: Oral steroids, acyclovir, clindamycin (no benefit). One intratympanic injection.
history.patient_goals: Improve communication; currently using loaner Pocketalker.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear: Severe mixed hearing loss (250-2000 Hz), rising to moderate SNHL at 3000 Hz, sloping to severe SNHL (4000-6000 Hz). Left ear: Moderate-to-severe mixed hearing loss. Masking was limited by patient discomfort (right) and magnitude of loss (left).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: Left ear shows normal word recognition ability. Right ear word recognition could not be measured due to sound sensitivity.

numeric_results.Right_WRS: DNT (Did Not Test due to discomfort)

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.key_findings: Not performed due to previous stapedotomy in the right ear and clinic protocol regarding surgically modified ears.

history.present_illness: Follow-up two weeks after a second dexamethasone injection.
history.prior_management: Second intratympanic injection performed after V1.
history.patient_goals: Determine if hearing improved; medical clearance for amplification.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Left ear stable. Right ear hearing decreased slightly. Otologist decided against further injections or surgery on the left ear.

numeric_results.Right_Ear_Change: Decrease by 10 dB HL at 500 and 3000 Hz; Decrease by 25 dB HL at 6000 and 8000 Hz

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient presents with a complex bilateral mixed hearing loss. The left ear shows a stable moderate-to-severe mixed loss with excellent word recognition. The right ear (post-stapedotomy) has a severe mixed/sensorineural loss with extreme hyperacusis (LDLs at 10 dB SL) and unmeasurable word recognition. The asymmetry and right-sided tolerance issues present significant challenges for standard binaural amplification.
counseling_points: Due to the extreme sensitivity in your right ear, putting a hearing aid in that ear is not recommended right now.
We can consider a 'BiCROS' system: a microphone on your right ear sends sound to a hearing aid in your left ear, so you can hear sounds from both sides through your better ear.
Another option is a single hearing aid for just your left ear, though you would still miss sounds from your right side.
Communication strategies are vital: face each other, stay within 3 feet, and choose quiet areas for conversation.
notes_for_actor: You are extremely sensitive to loud sounds in your right ear. You should wear an earplug in the right ear during the examination.
React with visible discomfort if the audiologist plays loud sounds or speaks too loudly near your right side.
You are anxious about your communication difficulties but hesitant about devices that might make things too loud.
